results.title: Henry V
results.creator_credit: Cedric Messina, BBC and David Giles
results.brief_description: Shortly after his coronation, Henry V decided to press his claims to the French throne and leads an army into France. He defeats a vastly larger French army at Agincourt (1415), wins the hand of the French Princess Catherine of Valois, and is recognised as the heir to the French throne.
results.description: Shortly after his coronation, Henry V decided to press his claims to the French throne and leads an army into France. results.title: Henry Morton Stanley
results.creator_credit: Michael Latham, Fred Burnley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
This film re-enacts the journey Stanley undertook to complete Livingstone’s exploration by searching for the headwaters of the Lualaba River in central Africa. Narrated by David Attenborough. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Henry Moore: master sculptor
results.brief_description: Sculptor Henry Moore discusses and demonstrates how he develops an idea, showing the various steps in the completion of a sculpture and many examples of his work.

results.title: Henry Moore
results.brief_description: An analysis of the work of the British sculptor, Henry Moore, and an interview with the artist himself. The film shows, in detail, a number of examples of his work and then follows all stages in the creation of a bronze statue commissioned for the Festival of Britain.

results.title: Henry IV. Part 1. (Perspective)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Shakespeare in Perspective Series”.
Designed to give a greater understanding and appreciation of the play by placing it in its historical and social context and by stressing its relevance for a modern-day audience. Perspective offered by George Melly, singer, writer and entertainer.

results.title: Henry IV. Part 1 (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Cedric Messina, David Giles and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Jon Finch as King Henry IV, David Gwillim as Prince Hal, Anthony Quayle as Falstaff. Shakespeare’s play is the dark portrait of a king who comes to the throne with blood on his hands. Having killed Richard III, he is guilt ridden by the knowledge of his foul deed. A usurper himself he is now being plotted against by those who helped him to power.

results.title: Henry Ford 1863-1947
results.brief_description: Deals with the history and development of Henry Ford’s industrial empire. Archival film and re-enactments show events such as the building of the early car models, their effect on society, his relations with organised labour, and the impact of the Great Depression.
results.description: Deals with the history and development of Henry Ford’s industrial empire. Archival film and re-enactments show events such as the building of the early car models, their effect on society, his relations with organised labour, and the impact of the Great Depression.

results.title: Henry Ford's America
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Paul Wright, Donald Brittain, Roman Kroitor and Janet Leissner
results.brief_description: An inside look at the workings of the Ford Motor Company. Traces the history of the company using historical footage, and interviews with Henry Ford II and other company executives. Looks at the developing role of the car within American society. Script, Donald Brittain. Editing, Rosemarie Shapely and Les Halman. Images, Andreas Poulsson. Music, Art Phillips.
